column2: UTAH DMV PERMIT PRACTICE TEST
column4: Utah

column2: Question Text
column4: Answer1 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. To drive more safely at night:
column4: donâ€™t drive when you are tired.
column8: make sure your headlights are working properly.

column2: 2. What do warning signs mean?
column4: Danger ahead.
column6: Drivers are approaching a hazardous location.
column8: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.

column2: 3. What should drivers do when they see this road sign?
column4: increase their speed to cross the intersection before a train arrives.
column8: slow down, look for a train, and be prepared to stop.
column10: come to a complete stop and wait for a train to cross.

column2: 4. This sign indicates:
column4: A slow-moving vehicle
column8: A shared lane

column2: 5. What does a flashing yellow light mean?
column4: Drivers may move forward with caution.
column8: The same thing as a stop sign.

column2: 6. When making a turn, drivers must _____ their speed.
column4: increase
column8: double

column2: 7. What is the main reason night driving is more difficult than daytime driving?
column4: Reduced visibility.
column6: The use of headlight is required by law.
column8: Driving within the range.

column2: 8. This sign warns drivers that:
column4: they will soon be facing oncoming traffic.
column8: a shared lane starts ahead.

column2: 9. This sign tells drivers that:
column4: left and right turns are not allowed.
column8: they cannot go straight ahead.
column10: they must stop at the next intersection.

column2: 10. This road sign warns drivers that:
column4: the dirt on the side of the road is soft.
column6: the road surface ahead changes to a low-type surface or earth road.
column8: vehicles must leave the pavement immediately.

column2: 11. When approaching someone using a white cane, you should proceed with caution because:
column4: the pedestrian is deaf.
column8: the pedestrian might be using a guide dog.

column2: 12. ___________ normally are white rectangles with black letters or symbols.
column4: Service signs
column8: Warning signs

column2: 13. A broken white line:
column4: marks the right edge of the roadway.
column6: means passing or crossing is prohibited in that lane.
column8: separates two lanes traveling in the same direction.

column2: 14. This sign indicates:
column4: a no passing zone.
column8: a cross road.

column2: 15. What is a likely effect when you take another drug while you drink alcohol?
column4: The effects of the alcohol and the drug are enhanced.
column6: There are no effects, unless the drug is prescription only.
column8: The effects of alcohol are reduced by the drug.
column10: If the drug is over-the-counter, there are no effects.

column2: 16. Drinking alcoholic beverages:
column4: gives you a feeling of false confidence.
column8: slows your reaction time.

column2: 17. Bicycles:
column4: have the same rights and duties as motorized vehicles.
column6: should use proper hand signals before making turns.
column8: have the right to ride on most roads.

column2: 18. When an aggressive driver confronts you, you should:
column4: Remain calm and relaxed.
column8: Report aggressive drivers to law enforcement authorities.

column2: 19. What does a red arrow on a traffic light mean?
column4: You may proceed slowly through the intersection.
column6: You must stop. Do not go in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.
column8: You may turn in the direction of the arrow.
column10: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.

column2: 20. A traffic light shows both a red light and a green arrow. The driver may not turn in the direction of the arrow until the red light has changed.
column4: False

column2: 21. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before any oncoming vehicle comes within 200 feet of them.
column6: they approach a curve on a two-way road and can not see around it.
column8: their lane has a solid yellow center line.

column2: 22. A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
column4: Passing is permitted on the side of the solid yellow line
column6: Passing is permitted on the side of the broken yellow line
column8: Passing is not permitted in either direction
column10: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction

column2: 23. Drivers may pass another vehicle if the line dividing two lanes is a ________ line.
column4: broken white
column8: solid yellow

column2: 24. How can you prevent fatigue on a long trip?
column4: Schedule regular stops for every couple of hours.
column6: Plan to drive long trips with a companion.
column8: Get enough sleep.

column2: 25. Select the most effective safety restraint(s) in a traffic crash.
column4: Air bag only
column8: A combination of lap/shoulder belt and air bag.
